Executive Summary



The Morrill Water Treatment Plant (MWTP) is owned and maintained by the Beeville Water Supply District (BWSD). However, the City of Beeville has full legal responsibility for the Morrill Water Treatment Plant (MWTP), including the authority to make all policy and procedure decisions for this facility.



The Morrill Water Treatment Plant (MWTP) is located in Mathis, Texas, and utilizes chlorine for the treatment of raw water. Morrill Water Treatment Plant (MWTP) is subject to the requirements of the EPA Risk Management Program for chlorine which is an EPA regulated substance.  Chlorine is used to disinfect water before it is delivered to the City of Beeville. The facility treats an average flow of 3.5 million gallons per day (MGD) of treated water and has the capacity to store 12,000 pounds (lbs.) of chlorine. The chlorine at the facility are contained in two 1-ton containers that are on a standby/on-line basis to ensure the chlorination process is continuous. Chlorine is drawn from the 1-ton containers in a gaseous state.



The City of Beeville has contracted day to day operations and maintenance to INFRAMARK.  All decisions concerning the Risk Management Program for this facility shall be made by the City of Beeville or their duly appointed liaison with input from the INFRAMARK  on-site operations personnel. 



A member of the City of Beeville is designated as the RMP Liaison. The RMP Liaison has delegated responsibility for overseeing implementation of this Risk Management Program to the Contract Operator.



The RMP team member responsibilities are identified below:

The Morrill Water Treatment Plant (MWTP) has not had any accidental releases of a regulated substance t

hat caused on-site or off-site injuries, deaths, property damage or environmental damage within the past five years. Any future release incidents shall be documented and incorporated into the Risk Management Program within six months of any reportable accident occurrence.

?    Training programs                    

?    Contractor Program 

?    Maintenance programs    

?    Emergency response  program

?    Management of change process



Any significant ?change to the equipment or processes at the Morrill Water Treatment Plant (MWTP) should prompt a review and update of these elements of the prevention program. Elements of the prevention program shall be reviewed and updated after any significant change to the equipment or processes at the Morrill Water Treatment Plant (MWTP). Any significant change to the prevention program elements requires an update of the Risk Management Plan information submitted to the EPA. A compliance audit must be performed at least once every three years, with documentation records maintained for at least five years.



SECTION 1: GENERAL INFORMATION



Risk Management Plan Applicability

As provided in Section 68, Chapter 40 of Code of Federal Regulations (40 CFR ?68), an owner or operator of a stationary source that has more than a threshold quantity of a regulated substance in a process must comply with the requirements for submission of a Risk Management Plan to the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA).



The Morrill Water Treatment Plant (MWTP) utilizes chlorine. This substance may be stored at this facility in quantities above the threshold quantity as defined by 40 CFR ?68.130. This facility is subject to the requirements of 40 CFR ?68.  



Facility

The Morrill Water Treatment Plant

(MWTP) is owned by the Beeville Water Supply District (BWSD). The City of Beeville, has full financial and legal responsibility of the facility. The City of Beeville has contracted day to day operations and maintenance to INFRAMARK.  All decisions concerning the Risk Management Program for this facility shall be made by the City Weslaco or their duly appointed liaison with input from the INFRAMARK  on-site operations personnel. 



The Morrill Water Treatment Plant (MWTP) EPA-RMP Facility Identifier number assigned is 100000172181. This number must be used on all correspondence with the EPA regarding the Risk Management Plan for the Morrill Water Treatment Plant (MWTP). The n Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code for a Water Treatment/Distribution Plant is 221320 . 



Location

The MWTP Water Treatment Plant (MWTP) is located at 1881 FM 534, Mathis, Texas in Live Oak County.

At any one time there may be six 1-ton cylinders of chlorine at the site.

Chlorine    7782-50-5    2,500 lbs.    12,000 lbs.    Toxic



Chlorine is stored in 1-ton cylinders at the Morrill Water Treatment Plant (MWTP).  Each of these 1-ton cylinders alone does not meet the threshold requirements for these regulated substances. However, the proximity of the vessels to each other requires that the total quantity of a regulated substance stored on-site must be taken into account when determining if a threshold quantity is reached.



Chlorine is stored as a liquid chemical in the 1-ton cylinder containers. However, as sp

ace is created inside the container by use of the chemical, a vapor forms to fill the void space, creating a two-phase chemical storage with the chlorine being present in both liquid and vapor form. 



Program Level



The EPA's Risk Management Plan reporting requirements are applicable at three different program levels. Each program level requires a certain degree of responsive planning and preventative actions.



The MWTP Water Treatment Plant (MWTP) falls into the Program 3 category. Therefore, this Risk Management Program is prepared in accordance with RMP Program Level 3 requirements.



Management System



A member of the City of Beeville is designated as the RMP Liaison. The individual occupying the designated position is subject to change due to? changes in the city organization.  However, there shall be an individual designated as the RMP Liaison at all times. The RMP Liaison has delegated responsibility for overseeing implementation of this Risk Management Program and delegating various RMP compliance tasks to the Contract Operator and other consultants as necessary.
